snippet: The captain of the commuter vessel that slammed into a Manhattan dock said that he tried to make the boat go into reverse, but it did not respond as anticipated.
abstract: Jason Reimer, captain of Seastreak commuter ferry that slammed into Lower Manhattan dock, injuring scores of passengers, meets with National Transportation Safety Board investigators; Reimer tells them that the ferry's control system did not respond as he tried to put the boat into reverse near shore, and that both diesel engines shut off without warning.
lead_paragraph: The captain of the commuter vessel that slammed into a Manhattan dock said that he tried to make the boat go into reverse, but it did not respond as anticipated.

headline.seo: Focus Is on Crashed Ferry’s Control System
headline.main: Day After Crash, Focus Is on Ferry’s Control System
headline.print_headline: Day After Crash of Ferry, Focus Moves to Control System
